metadata.title: CVE-2021-3744 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernel in theccp_run_aes_gcm_cmd() function in drivers/crypto/ccp/ccp-ops.c, whichallows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption). Thisvulnerability is similar with the older CVE-2019-18808.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-163-generic - 4.15.0-163.171
